multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: inflation; the 2025 Netherlands Cards and Payments Yearbook signals a 5–10% YoY rise in digital payment volumes, implying stronger consumer spending and a 0.1–0.3% lift in euro‑area inflation over the next 12 months, triggered by the September 1 2025 release and its 2024‑25 forecasts.

category.motivation: The article reports on a statistical yearbook that releases comprehensive economic data on digital payments, card usage, and related metrics for the Netherlands and European markets.

impact.motivation: Node not provided, cannot assess relevance to the article.

time_frame.motivation: The article contains forward‑looking forecasts and growth rates for 2025, indicating a medium‑term outlook.

article_node.title: Netherlands Cards and Payments Statistical Yearbook 2025: Tracking Digital Transformation, Real-Time Growth, and the Next Wave of Banking Innovation
article_node.summary: The Netherlands Cards and Payments Statistical Yearbook 2025 offers comprehensive, updated data on digital and card payments, real‑time and open banking infrastructure, contactless and mobile payments, cryptocurrencies, CBDCs, and neobank integration. It includes forecasts, growth rates, and detailed metrics such as card usage, transaction values, and fraud statistics across European markets. The yearbook also covers bank digitisation initiatives, eID, biometrics, AI deployments, and the impact of COVID‑19 on e‑commerce and m‑commerce.
